English Translation: Hi, how are you?
I’m fine, thank you. And you?

Bulgarian Phrase: И аз съм добре. Хубав ден, нали?
Pronunciation: I az sŭm do-bre. Khu-bav den, na-li?
English Translation: I’m good too. Nice day, isn’t it?
Yes, perfect weather for coffee.
What will you drink?
A cappuccino, please.
I’ll have a cappuccino too.
Do you come here often?
Yes, I love this place.

Bulgarian Phrase: Може би ще се видим пак.
Pronunciation: Mo-zhe bi shte se vi-dim pak.
English Translation: Maybe we’ll meet again.
With pleasure.
I'm looking for an apartment in this area.
What type of property are you interested in?
I prefer a two-room apartment.
There are a few listings nearby.
Can we see them?

Bulgarian Phrase: Разбира се. Кога ви е удобно?
Pronunciation: Raz-bi-ra se. Ko-ga vi e u-dob-no?
English Translation: Of course. When is convenient for you?
Tomorrow afternoon would be good.

Bulgarian Phrase: Има ли нещо задължително за вас?
Pronunciation: I-ma li ne-shto za-dŭl-zhit-el-no za vas?
English Translation: Is there anything essential for you?

Bulgarian Phrase: Да има балкон и добра светлина.
Pronunciation: Da ima bal-kon i do-bra svet-li-na.
English Translation: A balcony and good light are important.
This apartment has both.
How much does it cost?

Pronunciation: Tse-na-ta e sto i pe-deset hi-lya-di le-va.
English Translation: The price is 150,000 leva.
Are the furnishings included?
Yes, everything is included.
What is the monthly tax?
Around 100 leva per month.
Is there parking?

Bulgarian Phrase: Да, има място за една кола.
Pronunciation: Da, i-ma myas-to za ed-na ko-la.
English Translation: Yes, there's space for one car.

Bulgarian Phrase: Мога ли да говоря с агента?
Pronunciation: Mo-ga li da go-vo-rya s a-gen-ta?
English Translation: Can I speak with the agent?
I'll give you his number.
Thank you for your help.
I'm at your service.
Lately I’ve been feeling tense.

Bulgarian Phrase: Има ли нещо конкретно, което те притеснява?
Pronunciation: I-ma li ne-shto kon-kret-no, ko-e-to te pri-te-snya-va?
English Translation: Is there something specific that’s bothering you?
My job is very demanding.

Bulgarian Phrase: Разбирам. Стресът може да бъде изтощителен.
Pronunciation: Raz-bi-ram. Stres-ŭt mo-zhe da bŭ-de iz-tosh-chi-te-len.
English Translation: I understand. Stress can be exhausting.

Bulgarian Phrase: Понякога ми е трудно да се отпусна.
Pronunciation: Po-nyak-o-ga mi e trud-no da se ot-pus-na.
English Translation: Sometimes it’s hard for me to relax.

Bulgarian Phrase: Опитвала ли си медитация или дълбоко дишане?
Pronunciation: O-pit-va-la li si me-di-ta-tsi-ya i-li dŭl-bo-ko di-sha-ne?
English Translation: Have you tried meditation or deep breathing?

Bulgarian Phrase: Да, но не винаги ми помага.
Pronunciation: Da, no ne vi-na-gi mi po-ma-ga.
English Translation: Yes, but it doesn’t always help.

Bulgarian Phrase: Може би разходка сред природата ще ти подейства добре.
Pronunciation: Mo-zhe bi raz-hod-ka sred pri-ro-da-ta shte ti po-deyst-va do-bre.
English Translation: Maybe a walk in nature would help.
Sounds nice. I love peaceful places.

Bulgarian Phrase: Важно е да се грижиш за себе си.
Pronunciation: Vazh-no e da se gri-zhish za se-be si.
English Translation: It’s important to take care of yourself.

Bulgarian Phrase: Понякога се чувствам виновен, когато си почивам.
Pronunciation: Po-nyak-o-ga se chuvs-tvam vi-nov-en, ko-ga-to si po-chi-vam.
English Translation: Sometimes I feel guilty when I rest.

Bulgarian Phrase: Почивката не е слабост, а необходимост.
Pronunciation: Po-chi-vka-ta ne e slab-ost, a ne-ob-ho-di-most.
English Translation: Rest is not weakness, it’s a necessity.

Bulgarian Phrase: Имаш ли свои начини за справяне със стреса?
Pronunciation: I-mash li svo-i na-chi-ni za spra-vya-ne sŭs stre-sa?
English Translation: Do you have your own ways of coping with stress?

Bulgarian Phrase: Обичам да слушам музика и да чета.
Pronunciation: O-bi-cham da slu-sham mu-zi-ka i da che-ta.
English Translation: I like listening to music and reading.
Music really soothes me.

Bulgarian Phrase: Понякога просто трябва да си дадем време.
Pronunciation: Po-nyak-o-ga pros-to tryab-va da si da-dem vre-me.
English Translation: Sometimes we just need to give ourselves time.
Thank you for listening to me.

Bulgarian Phrase: Винаги съм тук, ако имаш нужда.
Pronunciation: Vi-na-gi sŭm tuk, a-ko i-mash nu-zhda.
English Translation: I’m always here if you need me.
That means a lot to me.

Bulgarian Phrase: Грижата един за друг ни прави по-силни.
Pronunciation: Gri-zha-ta e-din za drug ni pra-vi po-sil-ni.
English Translation: Caring for each other makes us stronger.
Do you play football?
Yes, I play in an amateur team.
Which team is your favourite?
I follow Levski and CSKA.
What do you think about today's game?

Bulgarian Phrase: Беше вълнуващо, но отбора ни загуби.
Pronunciation: Beshe valnuvashcho, no otbora ni zagubi.
English Translation: It was exciting but our team lost.
Do you go to training often?
I train three times a week.

Bulgarian Phrase: Обичаш ли да гледаш спорт по телевизията?
Pronunciation: Obichash li da gledash sport po televiziyata?
English Translation: Do you like watching sports on TV?
I prefer watching live.

Bulgarian Phrase: Кой е най-добрият играч на отбора?
Pronunciation: Koy e nay-dobriyat igrach na otbora?
English Translation: Who is the best player on the team?

Bulgarian Phrase: Той е бърз и силен, отличен нападател.
Pronunciation: Toy e barz i silen, otlichen napadatel.
English Translation: He is fast and strong, an excellent striker.
Do you play other sports?

Bulgarian Phrase: Понякога ходя на тенис и волейбол.
Pronunciation: Ponyakoga hodya na tenis i voleybol.
English Translation: Sometimes I go to tennis and volleyball.

Bulgarian Phrase: Какво мислиш за формата на вратаря?
Pronunciation: Kakvo mislish za formata na vratarya?
English Translation: What do you think about the goalkeeper's form?

Bulgarian Phrase: Мисля, че трябва да работи върху спасителните си реакции.
Pronunciation: Mishlya, che tryabva da raboti varhu spasitelnite si reaktsii.
English Translation: I think he needs to work on his save reactions.
Will you watch the match tomorrow?

Bulgarian Phrase: Да, ще бъде забавно да го гледаме заедно.
Pronunciation: Da, shte bade zabavno da go gledame zaedno.
English Translation: Yes, it will be fun to watch it together.
How many goals did he score this season?
He has scored eight goals so far.

Bulgarian Phrase: Трябва ли да отбележа тренировката в календара?
Pronunciation: Tryabva li da otbelezha trenirovkata v kalendara?
English Translation: Should I mark the training in the calendar?

Bulgarian Phrase: Да, така няма да го забравиш.
Pronunciation: Da, taka nyama da go zabravish.
English Translation: Yes, that way you won't forget it.

Bulgarian Phrase: Пожелавам ви успех на утрешния мач!
Pronunciation: Pozhelavam vi uspeh na utreshniya mach!
English Translation: I wish you good luck for tomorrow's match!
Thanks! I hope we win.

Bulgarian Phrase: Имаше един човек, който влезе в бар... Опа!
Pronunciation: Ima-she edin cho-vek, koy-to vle-ze v bar... Opa!
English Translation: There was a man who walked into a bar... Oops!

Bulgarian Phrase: Защо пилеца пресече пътя? За да стигне до другата страна!
Pronunciation: Za-shto pi-le-tsa pre-se-che pa-tya? Za da stig-ne do dru-ga-ta stra-na!
English Translation: Why did the chicken cross the road? To get to the other side!

Bulgarian Phrase: Колко програмисти са нужни за смяна на крушка? Нито един - това е хардуерен проблем.
Pronunciation: Kol-ko pro-gram-i-sti sa nuzh-ni za smya-na na krush-ka? Ni-to edin - to-va e har-du-er-en prob-lem.
English Translation: How many programmers does it take to change a lightbulb? None - that's a hardware problem.

Bulgarian Phrase: Срещнах приятел и той каза: 'Изглеждаш уморен.' Аз отвърнах: 'Не съм уморен, просто лицето ми се е отказало.'
Pronunciation: Sresht-nah pri-ya-tel i toy ka-za: 'Iz-glezh-dash u-mo-ren.' Az ot-var-nah: 'Ne sam u-mo-ren, prosto li-tse-to mi se e ot-ka-za-lo.'
English Translation: I met a friend and he said: 'You look tired.' I replied: 'I'm not tired, just my face has given up.'

Bulgarian Phrase: Какво казва един компютър на другия? 'Спри да ме вирусираш!'
Pronunciation: Kak-vo ka-z-va edin kom-pyu-tar na dru-gi-ya? 'Spri da me vi-ru-si-rash!'
English Translation: What does one computer say to another? 'Stop virus-ing me!'

Bulgarian Phrase: Защо математикът не харесва морето? Защото е пълно с алгебри...
Pronunciation: Za-shto ma-te-ma-ti-kat ne ha-re-sva mo-re-to? Za-sho-to e pal-no s al-ge-bri...
English Translation: Why doesn't the mathematician like the ocean? Because it's full of algae...

Bulgarian Phrase: Слушаш ли този нов шегич? Той е много повтарящ се!
Pronunciation: Slush-ash li to-zi nov she-gich? Toy e mnogo pov-ta-ryasht se!
English Translation: Are you listening to this new joke? It's very repetitive!

Bulgarian Phrase: Как се казва българската версия на супергерой? Супер-селянин!
Pronunciation: Kak se ka-z-va bal-gar-ska-ta ver-si-ya na su-per-geroy? Su-per-se-lya-nin!
English Translation: What's the Bulgarian version of a superhero called? Super-villager!

Bulgarian Phrase: Когато се смея твърде много, започвам да кихтя. Това е моят суперсила!
Pronunciation: Kog-ato se sme-ya tvar-de mno-go, za-po-chvam da kiht-ya. To-va e mo-yat su-per-si-la!
English Translation: When I laugh too much, I start sneezing. That's my superpower!

Bulgarian Phrase: Питат ме: 'Имаш ли чувство за хумор?' Отговарям: 'Зависи... понякога да, понякога не, понякога може би.'
Pronunciation: Pi-tat me: 'Imash li chuv-stvo za hu-mor?' Ot-go-va-ryam: 'Za-vi-si... po-nya-ko-ga da, po-nya-ko-ga ne, po-nya-ko-ga mo-zhe bi.'
English Translation: They ask me: 'Do you have a sense of humor?' I answer: 'It depends... sometimes yes, sometimes no, sometimes maybe.'

Bulgarian Phrase: Защо баницата отишла при психолога? Защото се чувствала твърде нарязана!
Pronunciation: Za-shto ba-ni-tsa-ta o-tish-la pri psi-ho-lo-ga? Za-sho-to se chuv-stva-la tvar-de na-rya-za-na!
English Translation: Why did the banitsa go to the psychologist? Because it felt too cut up!

Bulgarian Phrase: Какво прави един българин, когато му е студено? Включва парното и отваря прозореца!
Pronunciation: Kak-vo pra-vi edin bal-ga-rin, ko-ga-to mu e stu-de-no? Vklyuch-va par-no-to i ot-va-rya pro-zo-ret-sa!
English Translation: What does a Bulgarian do when he's cold? Turns on the heating and opens the window!

Bulgarian Phrase: Най-смешната дума на български? 'Пръдня' - дори звучи смешно!
Pronunciation: Nay-smesh-na-ta du-ma na bal-gar-ski? 'Prad-nya' - do-ri zvuchi smesh-no!
English Translation: The funniest word in Bulgarian? 'Fart' - it even sounds funny!
What musical instrument do you play?

Bulgarian Phrase: Свиря на китара от пет години.
Pronunciation: Svi-rya na ki-ta-ra ot pet go-di-ni.
English Translation: I've been playing guitar for five years.
Do you want to form a band?

Bulgarian Phrase: Какъв е любимият ти музикален жанр?
Pronunciation: Ka-kav e lyu-bi-mi-yat ti mu-zi-ka-len zhanr?
English Translation: What's your favorite music genre?
I love Bulgarian folk music.
This singer has an amazing voice.

Bulgarian Phrase: Бих искал да науча да свиря на пиано.
Pronunciation: Bih is-kal da na-u-cha da svi-rya na pi-a-no.
English Translation: I would like to learn to play piano.

Bulgarian Phrase: Кой е най-добрият концерт, на който си бил?
Pronunciation: Koy e nay-do-bri-yat kon-tsert, na koy-to si bil?
English Translation: What's the best concert you've been to?

Bulgarian Phrase: Има ли добри музикални училища в София?
Pronunciation: I-ma li do-bri mu-zi-kal-ni u-chi-li-shcha v So-fi-ya?
English Translation: Are there good music schools in Sofia?

Bulgarian Phrase: Тази песен има много добър ритъм.
Pronunciation: Ta-zi pe-sen i-ma mnogo do-bar ri-tam.
English Translation: This song has a very good rhythm.

Bulgarian Phrase: Можеш ли да пееш в тон?
Pronunciation: Mo-zhesh li da pe-esh v ton?
English Translation: Can you sing in tune?

Bulgarian Phrase: Кои са твоите любими български изпълнители?
Pronunciation: Ko-i sa tvo-i-te lyu-bi-mi bal-gar-ski iz-pal-ni-te-li?
English Translation: Who are your favorite Bulgarian performers?
I love old Bulgarian rock bands.

Bulgarian Phrase: Трябва да купя нови струни за китарата.
Pronunciation: Tryab-va da ku-pya no-vi stru-ni za ki-ta-ra-ta.
English Translation: I need to buy new strings for my guitar.
Do you have perfect pitch?

Bulgarian Phrase: Този барабанист има невероятно чувство за ритъм.
Pronunciation: To-zi ba-ra-ba-nist i-ma ne-ve-ro-yat-no chuv-stvo za ri-tam.
English Translation: This drummer has an incredible sense of rhythm.
Where can I buy sheet music?
Do you like classical music?
Beethoven is my favorite composer.

Bulgarian Phrase: Искаш ли да отидем на концерт тази вечер?
Pronunciation: Is-kash li da o-ti-dem na kon-tsert ta-zi ve-cher?
English Translation: Do you want to go to a concert tonight?
How much does a festival ticket cost?
This hall has wonderful acoustics.

Bulgarian Phrase: Можеш ли да ми помогнеш с този акорд?
Pronunciation: Mo-zhesh li da mi po-mog-nesh s to-zi akord?
English Translation: Can you help me with this chord?

Bulgarian Phrase: Трябва да упражнявам по два часа всеки ден.
Pronunciation: Tryab-va da up-raz-nya-vam po dva cha-sa vse-ki den.
English Translation: I need to practice two hours every day.

Bulgarian Phrase: Кой е най-труден инструмент за свирене?
Pronunciation: Koy e nay-tru-den in-stru-ment za svi-re-ne?
English Translation: What's the most difficult instrument to play?

Bulgarian Phrase: Обичам да слушам джаз докато работя.
Pronunciation: O-bi-cham da slu-sham dzhaz do-ka-to ra-bo-tya.
English Translation: I love listening to jazz while working.

Bulgarian Phrase: Този сингъл е върху върха на класациите.
Pronunciation: To-zi sin-gal e var-hu var-ha na kla-sa-tsi-i-te.
English Translation: This single is at the top of the charts.
I want to record my own song.
Do you have a guitar amplifier?

Bulgarian Phrase: Коя е твоята любима песен от детството?
Pronunciation: Ko-ya e tvo-ya-ta lyu-bi-ma pe-sen ot det-stvo-to?
English Translation: What's your favorite song from childhood?
This musician is a true virtuoso.

Bulgarian Phrase: Харесвам как смесват традиционни и модерни звуци.
Pronunciation: Ha-res-vam kak smes-vat tra-di-tsi-on-ni i mo-der-ni zvut-si.
English Translation: I like how they mix traditional and modern sounds.
When is your next rehearsal?
I need to tune my guitar.

Bulgarian Phrase: Има ли добри музикални магазини наоколо?
Pronunciation: I-ma li do-bri mu-zi-kal-ni ma-ga-zi-ni na-o-ko-lo?
English Translation: Are there good music stores around?
I love singing in the shower.
This melody is very addictive.

Bulgarian Phrase: Кой е твоят любим текст в българска музика?
Pronunciation: Koy e tvo-yat lyu-bim tekst v bal-gar-ska mu-zi-ka?
English Translation: What's your favorite lyric in Bulgarian music?

Bulgarian Phrase: Искам да науча да чета ноти.
Pronunciation: Is-kam da na-u-cha da che-ta no-ti.
English Translation: I want to learn to read sheet music.
This bass guitarist is exceptional.

Bulgarian Phrase: Колко време отне да научиш тази песен?
Pronunciation: Kol-ko vre-me ot-ne da na-u-chish ta-zi pe-sen?
English Translation: How long did it take you to learn this song?

Bulgarian Phrase: Музиката ми помага да се релаксирам.
Pronunciation: Mu-zi-ka-ta mi po-ma-ga da se re-lak-si-ram.
English Translation: Music helps me relax.

Bulgarian Phrase: Имаш ли предложения за нова музика?
Pronunciation: I-mash li pred-lo-zhe-ni-ya za no-va mu-zi-ka?
English Translation: Do you have suggestions for new music?

Bulgarian Phrase: Обичам да слушам музика докато пътувам.
Pronunciation: O-bi-cham da slu-sham mu-zi-ka do-ka-to pa-tu-vam.
English Translation: I love listening to music while traveling.

Bulgarian Phrase: Този албум е истинско произведение на изкуството.
Pronunciation: To-zi al-bum e is-tin-sko pro-iz-ve-de-nie na is-kus-tvo-to.
English Translation: This album is a true work of art.

Bulgarian Phrase: Коя е най-емоционалната песен, която познаваш?
Pronunciation: Ko-ya e nay-e-mo-tsi-o-nal-na-ta pe-sen, ko-ya-to poz-na-vash?
English Translation: What's the most emotional song you know?

Bulgarian Phrase: Свириш ли на други инструменти освен китара?
Pronunciation: Svi-rish li na dru-gi in-stru-men-ti os-ven ki-ta-ra?
English Translation: Do you play other instruments besides guitar?
Music is a universal language.

Bulgarian Phrase: Кои са влиянията във вашата музика?
Pronunciation: Ko-i sa vli-ya-ni-ya-ta vav vasha-ta mu-zi-ka?
English Translation: What are the influences in your music?
I love the energy of live concerts.
I love you.
I miss you so much.
I want to be with you.
Can you hug me?
Kiss me.
You are very handsome/beautiful.
I like how you smell.

Bulgarian Phrase: Чувствам се добре, когато съм с теб.
Pronunciation: Chuv-stvam se do-bre, ko-ga-to sam s teb.
English Translation: I feel good when I am with you.

Bulgarian Phrase: Искам да прекарам повече време с теб.
Pronunciation: Is-kam da pre-ka-ram po-ve-che vre-me s teb.
English Translation: I want to spend more time with you.

Bulgarian Phrase: Ти си много специален/специална за мен.
Pronunciation: Ti si mno-go spe-tsi-a-len/spe-tsi-al-na za men.
English Translation: You are very special to me.
I trust you.
Do you feel comfortable?
How do you feel?
I want to make you happy.

Bulgarian Phrase: Можеш ли да останеш тази вечер?
Pronunciation: Mo-zhesh li da os-ta-nesh ta-zi ve-cher?
English Translation: Can you stay tonight?
Come closer to me.
Touch me.

Bulgarian Phrase: Това чувство между нас е силно.
Pronunciation: To-va chuv-stvo mezh-du nas e sil-no.
English Translation: This feeling between us is strong.
I like your touch.
Your voice excites me.
I want to kiss you.

Bulgarian Phrase: Погледът ти ме кара да се разтопя.
Pronunciation: Pog-le-dat ti me ka-ra da se raz-to-pya.
English Translation: Your gaze makes me melt.
Let's sleep together.
Be with me.

Bulgarian Phrase: Никой не ме кара да се чувствам така както ти.
Pronunciation: Ni-koy ne me ka-ra da se chuv-stvam ta-ka kak-to ti.
English Translation: No one makes me feel the way you do.

Bulgarian Phrase: Мисля за теб през целия ден.
Pronunciation: Mis-lya za teb prez tse-li-ya den.
English Translation: I think about you all day.

Bulgarian Phrase: Ти си първото ми мисълeне сутрин.
English Translation: You are my first thought in the morning.

Bulgarian Phrase: Чувствам се в безопасност с теб.
Pronunciation: Chuv-stvam se v be-zo-pas-nost s teb.
English Translation: I feel safe with you.

Bulgarian Phrase: Не мога да прекратя да се усмихвам, когато съм с теб.
Pronunciation: Ne mo-ga da pre-kra-tya da se us-mih-vam, ko-ga-to sam s teb.
English Translation: I can't stop smiling when I'm with you.

Bulgarian Phrase: Ти си точно това, което искам.
Pronunciation: Ti si toch-no to-va, ko-e-to is-kam.
English Translation: You are exactly what I want.
I desire you.

Bulgarian Phrase: Да се насладим един на друг.
Pronunciation: Da se nas-la-dim edin na drug.
English Translation: Let's enjoy each other.
What do you like?
Does this feel good for you?

Bulgarian Phrase: Можеш ли да ми покажеш какво ти харесва?
Pronunciation: Mo-zhesh li da mi po-ka-zhesh kak-vo ti ha-re-sva?
English Translation: Can you show me what you like?

Bulgarian Phrase: Не се притеснявай да ми кажеш.
Pronunciation: Ne se pri-tes-nyavay da mi ka-zhesh.
English Translation: Don't hesitate to tell me.
Everything is okay.
I'm taking my time with you.
You are so soft.
Your skin is so soft.
I love how you smile.
Your warmth calms me.

Bulgarian Phrase: Нека просто да лежим и да се наслаждаваме.
Pronunciation: Ne-ka prost-o da le-zhim i da se nas-lazh-da-va-me.
English Translation: Let's just lie here and enjoy.
You are my dream come true.

Bulgarian Phrase: Никога не съм се чувствал/чувствала така.
Pronunciation: Ni-ko-ga ne sam se chuv-stval/chuv-stva-la ta-ka.
English Translation: I have never felt this way before.
You are everything to me.
You make me happy.

Bulgarian Phrase: Искам да се грижа за теб.
Pronunciation: Is-kam da se gri-zha za teb.
English Translation: I want to take care of you.
Stay with me.
I am attracted to you.
Let's be close.
That was wonderful.
I don't feel well.
I have a fever.
My throat hurts.
I have a strong headache.
I suffer from nausea and vomiting.
I need to go to a doctor.
